newsitem.title: UK: Burmah unit to buy Air's releasants.
newsitem.headline: Burmah unit to buy Air's releasants.

text.p: British-based lubricants and chemicals group Burmah-Castrol Plc said on Tuesday its Chem-Trend Inc unit in North America had agreed to buy the releasants business of Air Products and Chemicals Inc.
No financial details of the transaction were disclosed but the company said the consideration was likely to be less than one percent of Burmah Castrol's net assets.
Releasants are used principally by the automotive industry to facilitate the release of components from their moulds.
In a statement Burmah Castrol said the acquisition would strengthen Chem-Trend's position in the European market, "enhance its technological capabilities and enable it to penetrate new markets".
The deal includes the acquisition of manufacturing and laboratory facilities in Europe, it added.
Closing of the deal, which is subject to regulatory approval, could take place in March, Burmah-Castrol said.
